# 總裁報告

2018年是全球金融危機發生十周年，十年間國際政經形勢經歷巨大轉變，當中不乏一幕幕超乎最佳編劇所能想像的場景。我在去年的年報指出，2017年金融市場表現是「喜出望外」，同時提到前景「潛藏隱憂」。回顧2018年，或許可形容為「先喜後悲」。環球多個股票指數在1月創出歷史新高後不久，熾熱的投資情緒旋即遇上中美貿易摩擦的冷鋒，加上英國脫歐談判一直拉鋸、地緣政治惡化、美聯儲四次加息等因素，市場樂觀氣氛急劇逆轉，資產價格在年內大幅下跌。MSCI全球指數從高點至低點曾下跌20.3%，全年累跌約一成，是2008年環球金融危機以來表現最差的一年。恒生指數從高點最多曾下跌26.7%，全年下挫13.6%，錄得七年來最大年度跌幅。

# 聯匯穩健 信心所繫

儘管外圍形勢波動難測，香港金融體系仍然保持穩健，貨幣市場運作暢順無阻。實施三十五年的聯繫匯率制度成功應對了資金流出港元的考驗。自環球金融危機爆發以來，累積約10,000億港元等值的資金流入港元。去年，隨着美國息率上升，港美息差持續擴闊，「沽港元、買美元」套息活動增加，港元兌美元匯率在年初轉弱，2005年制訂的「弱方兌換保證」，自4月首度觸發後，年內再觸發26次。金管局按照既定機制，履行「買港元、沽美元」的弱方兌換保證，有序、透明地在市場承接1,035億港元的港元沽盤。隨着資金流走，一個月香港銀行同業拆息在2018年內累升了105基點，而銀行亦在去年9月美國加息後，上調了最優惠利率。金管局多次和適時通過不同渠道向公眾闡釋「弱方兌換保證」的運作機制，令公眾了解資金流出港元是香港利率正常化的必經過程，也是聯匯制度的正常運作。國際貨幣基金組織在去年年底重申支持香港聯匯制度的立場，特區政府也強調聯匯是香港貨幣穩定的基石。這都有助於穩定香港市民對聯繫匯率的信心。

# 銀行體系 穩中有進

2008年環球金融危機暴露了全球金融系統潛藏的種種弊端及隱患，促使國際間在過去十年協調推出一系列針對金融市場、金融機構的改革，包括在銀行業監管方面，提升企業管治和風險管理。金管局的銀行監管工作重點針對兩方面：一是着眼於銀行資產負債風險的審慎監管，二是銀行的行為操守，二者不可偏廢。資產負債風險監管方面，金管局作為巴塞爾銀行監管委員會(Basel Committee on Banking Supervision)及二十國集團轄下金融穩定理事會(FinancialStability Board)成員，有責任全面落實國際監管標準，確保香港銀行業穩健審慎地經營業務。去年底香港銀行資本充足率達20.3%，不但遠高於國際最低標準要求的8%，也較環球金融危機時的14.7%水平顯著提升。大型銀行去年第四季平均流動覆蓋比率達167.6%，同樣遠高於法定最低要求的90%。與此同時，為避免重蹈環球金融危機時需動用公帑拯救「大得不能倒」金融機構的覆轍，金融穩定理事會制訂了關於金融機構處置機制的國際標準。香港是亞洲區內少數已經全面落實符合機制要求的地區之一，金管局下設的處置機制辦公室正落實該機制的操作細則，要求銀行推行結構性變動令處置預案在需要時能有效實施，去年亦推出了《吸收虧損能力規則》，未來還會陸續推出更多相關規則。

鑑於樓價持續上升，金管局未雨綢繆，在2009至2017年間共推出八輪逆周期措施，確保一旦地產市況逆轉，本港銀行體系有足夠的抗震能力應對衝擊。這些措施成效顯著：新造住宅平均按揭成數由2009年的64%降至2018年底的46%；平均供款與入息比率亦由2010年的41%下調至2018年底的34%。年內銀行信貸錄得4.4%的溫和增長，整體資產質素維持良好，零售銀行不良貸款比率進一步降至0.5%，遠低於國際及本港歷史平均水平。去年銀行業盈利持續增長，整體股東權益回報率連升兩年至13%；多家國際性銀行集團在本港的業務交出了不俗的成績表，成為集團盈利的重要支柱。

# 穩善文化 上行下效

在監管銀行的行為操守方面，金管局在2010年增設銀行操守部，促進銀行公平待客，並加強保障消費者權益。要做到標本兼治，除了訂出各種針對銀行營運基本操守的監管要求外，我們近年來大力推動改革銀行文化，鼓勵銀行循管治、獎勵制度、評估與回饋機制三方面推動穩善文化，務求銀行內部做到上行下效，在根本上恢復、提升客戶對銀行的信任和尊重。繼2017年金管局向全港銀行提供具體的指引，金管局在2018年底進一步推出銀行文化的監管措施，包括要求銀行就企業文化和落實有關措施作出自我評估等，令穩善銀行文化的三大支柱能有效執行。

雖然互聯網和移動金融是全球趨勢，金管局去年仍繼續促進普及金融，照顧未能應用新科技的社群。例如我們連同香港銀行公會推動便利店推出長者透過「易辦事」免購物提款服務，有關便利店網絡已增至逾300家；我們並聯絡香港郵政在7家主要位於離島和新界的郵政局推出長者提款易服務。銀行業界響應金管局的建議，年內積極增加無障礙設施，提供傷健共融的銀行服務，例子之一是設有聲音導航的自動櫃員機數目一年內增加逾十倍至超過700部。另外，在金管局積極推動下，我們預期將會陸續有銀行在偏遠地區開設更多實體分行和增設流動銀行服務，便利市民。

# 智慧銀行 嶄新體驗

金管局與銀行和科技業界緊密合作，在2017年9月啟動「智慧銀行新紀元」，推動香港金融科技發展和創新，為市民帶來嶄新的支付和銀行服務體驗。2018年的亮點，無疑是在9月正式開通的「轉數快」。它是全球獨一無二的零售快速支付系統，打破香港各種電子支付工具和銀行帳戶之間的屏障，讓市民享受全年無休的港元和人民幣即時轉帳服務。金管局還同步推出全球首個「共用二維碼」標準和應用程式，商戶可憑單個二維碼接通多個電子支付系統。「轉數快」推出以來深受市民歡迎，短短半年，登記紀錄已逾258萬個，日均交易量達6萬宗，平均每宗金額分別20,700港元和38,000元人民幣。

去年5月，金管局發出虛擬銀行的認可指引，隨即有33家機構提交虛擬銀行牌照的申請。截至今年四月中，四個牌照已經發出，預期它們將於年內正式投入營運。虛擬銀行有助推動香港金融科技發展和創新，為個人和中小企提供嶄新服務和體驗，並促進普及金融。

此外，金管局在7月發布開放應用程式介面(OpenAPI)框架，銀行將分四階段開放產品和服務的對外接口，開創更靈活、更開放的金融科技環境，讓銀行客戶更便捷地整合帳戶資料、獲取資訊，選取貼合自己需要的服務。年內，共有42項新科技產品使用金管局的金融科技監管沙盒進行測試，當中28項完成試行，有關產品和服務已順利推出市場。

金管局聯同多家銀行研發的「貿易聯動」去年10月正式啟用，這個採用「分布式分類帳技術」的貿易融資平台，將提升銀行審批貿易融資的效率。「貿易聯動」目前正在測試連接其他地區相關平台，以促進跨境貿易融資活動。

金融科技不但廣泛應用於日常生活，近年更走進合規和監管領域。金管局鼓勵銀行運用合規科技(Regtech)協助處理日常營運如監察涉嫌洗錢和恐怖分子資金籌集的可疑活動。與此同時金管局正研究使用監管科技(Suptech)，進一步提升監管工作的效率和成效。

# 金融實力 鞏固提升

國際金融中心之間是軟實力的較量，我們要不斷順應經濟社會和科技發展的變化，把握機遇，不斷為香港金融業開拓新的發展空間。綠色金融就是香港開拓債券和項目融資市場的一個重大機遇。金管局支持和配合特區政府發展綠色金融，除了配合特區政府籌備1,000億港元的政府綠色債券發行計劃，我們去年還舉辦多場綠色金融研討會，包括兩場國際大型會議，以提升市場對綠色金融的認識、了解和參與，並鼓勵發行機構參與政府去年推出的綠色債券資助計劃和香港的綠色金融認證服務。去年在港發行綠色債券規模逾110億美元，相等於2017年的三倍多。

近年來投資界對基建和相關項目興趣日濃。金管局於2016年成立基建融資促進辦公室(IFFO)，合作夥伴至今已倍增至95家機構，成為區內基建融資的重要交流平台。去年金管局與國務院國有資產監督管理委員會（國資委）首次合辦高層圓桌會議，討論香港為中央國有企業「走出去」的獨特優勢和作用，為央企與香港金融、專業服務界日後共拓發展機遇奠下良好基礎。

# Aggregate Report

2018 marked the tenth anniversary of the global financial crisis. Over the past ten years, the international political and economic landscape has undergone significant changes, with many episodes beyond the imagination of even the best scriptwriters. In last year’s annual report, I noted that the 2017 financial market performance was "surprisingly good," while also mentioning that the outlook "concealed hidden concerns." Looking back at 2018, it might be described as "started well but ended off-colour." Shortly after global stock indices reached record highs in January, the bullish investment sentiment quickly encountered the cold front of US-China trade tensions, compounded by the ongoing Brexit impasse, worsening geopolitical conditions, and four interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve. These factors led to a sharp reversal of the optimistic market sentiment, resulting in a significant decline in asset prices throughout the year. The MSCI Global Index fell 20.3% from its peak to its trough, ending the year with a drop of approximately 10%, marking its worst performance since the 2008 global financial crisis. The Hang Seng Index fell as much as 26.7% from its peak, declining by 13.6% for the year, recording its largest annual decline in seven years.

# Linked Exchange Rate System: Resilient, the Foundation of Confidence

Despite volatile external conditions, Hong Kong’s financial system remains resilient, and the currency market operates smoothly. The Linked Exchange Rate System, implemented for 35 years, has successfully coped with the challenge of capital outflows from the Hong Kong dollar. Since the outbreak of the global financial crisis, approximately HK$10,000 billion worth of funds has flowed into the Hong Kong dollar. Last year, as U.S. interest rates rose, the interest rate differential between Hong Kong and the U.S. continued to widen, leading to an increase in "sell Hong Kong dollars, buy U.S. dollars" carry trade activities. The Hong Kong dollar exchange rate against the U.S. dollar weakened at the beginning of the year. The "Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking," established in 2005, was first triggered in April and triggered 26 times during the year. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) fulfilled the "buy Hong Kong dollars, sell U.S. dollars" Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking in accordance with the established mechanism, orderly and transparently absorbing HK$103.5 billion of Hong Kong dollar selling pressure in the market. As capital flowed out, the one-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rates (HIBORs) recorded a cumulative increase of 105 basis points in 2018, and banks also adjusted upwards their prime lending rates following the U.S. interest rate hike in September last year. The HKMA has repeatedly and at appropriate times explained the operational mechanism of the "Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking" to the public through various channels, helping the public understand that capital outflows from the Hong Kong dollar are an inevitable process of interest rate normalization in Hong Kong and also a normal operation of the Linked Exchange Rate System. The International Monetary Fund reaffirmed its support for the Hong Kong Linked Exchange Rate System at the end of last year, and the HKSAR government also emphasized that the Linked Exchange Rate System is the cornerstone of Hong Kong’s currency stability. This has helped to stabilize the confidence of the people of Hong Kong in the Linked Exchange Rate System.

# The original text, “銀行體系 穩中有進,” translates to “Banking system: with stronger resilience and progress.” The junior translators have provided several versions, each with varying degrees of accuracy and fluency.
Translation 1: “The banking sector with stronger resilience and progress.” This version is grammatically correct but lacks a clear structure. It reads as a fragment rather than a complete sentence.
Translation 2: “Banking System: With Stronger Resilience and Progress.” This is a clear and concise translation, but it uses all caps for “Banking System,” which may not be necessary unless it's a title.
Translation 3: “Banking Sector: With Stronger Resilience and Progress.” This is very similar to Translation 2, but uses “Sector” instead of “System.” Both are acceptable, but “system” may be more accurate given the term “體系.”
Translation 4: “The banking sector is developing with stronger resilience.” This translation adds the verb “is developing,” which is not present in the original text. While it may be a reasonable interpretation, it introduces new information not in the original.
Translation 5: “Banking system with stronger resilience, progress.” This version is grammatically incomplete and lacks a clear structure. It also uses a comma instead of a conjunction, which may confuse the reader.
Translation 6: “Banking system: with stronger resilience and making progress.” This is a good attempt, but “making progress” is slightly more verbose than necessary. “Progress” alone would be sufficient.
Based on the above analysis, the best approach would be to use “Banking system: with stronger resilience and progress.” This version is concise, grammatically correct, and accurately reflects the original text. It uses the correct terms from the dictionary and maintains the intended meaning.
The final translation is:
Banking system: with stronger resilience and progress.

The 2008 global financial crisis exposed latent flaws and risks in the global financial system, prompting international coordination over the past decade to introduce a series of reforms targeting financial markets and financial institutions, including enhancing corporate governance and risk management in the banking sector. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) banking supervision focuses on two key areas: first, prudent supervision of banks' asset-liability risks; and second, banks' conduct standards, neither of which should be neglected. In terms of asset-liability risk supervision, as a member of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision and the Financial Stability Board under the G20, the HKMA has the responsibility to fully implement international regulatory standards, ensuring that the Hong Kong banking sector operates prudently and soundly. By the end of last year, the capital adequacy ratio of Hong Kong banks reached 20.3%, which is significantly higher than the international minimum standard of 8% and also a marked increase from the 14.7% level during the global financial crisis. Large banks' average liquidity coverage ratio reached 167.6% in the fourth quarter of last year, also significantly higher than the statutory minimum requirement of 90%. At the same time, to avoid repeating the mistakes of the global financial crisis, where public funds had to be used to rescue "too big to fail" financial institutions, the Financial Stability Board has established international standards for the resolution mechanisms of financial institutions. Hong Kong is one of the few regions in Asia that have fully implemented mechanisms meeting the requirements. The HKMA's Resolution Mechanism Office is implementing the operational details of the mechanism, requiring banks to implement structural changes to ensure that resolution plans can be effectively implemented when needed. Last year, the HKMA also introduced the "Loss-absorbing Capacity Rules," and more related rules will be introduced in the future.

In view of the continued rise in housing prices, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority took preemptive actions and launched a total of eight rounds of countercyclical measures between 2009 and 2017 to ensure that, in the event of a reversal in the property market, the local banking system would have sufficient resilience to cope with shocks. These measures proved highly effective: the average mortgage loan-to-value ratio for new residential properties fell from 64% in 2009 to 46% by the end of 2018; the average debt-to-income ratio also declined from 41% in 2010 to 34% by the end of 2018. During the year, banking credit recorded a moderate growth of 4.4%, with overall asset quality remaining good, and the non-performing loan ratio in retail banking further dropped to 0.5%, well below the international and local historical averages. Last year, the banking sector's profitability continued to grow, with the overall return on equity rising for two consecutive years to 13%; several international banking groups performed well in Hong Kong, becoming important pillars of their group's profitability.

# Sound and Virtuous Culture: Leadership by Example Influences All Levels
The translations provided by the junior translators vary in quality and accuracy. The first translation, "Sound and Virtuous Culture: Lead by Example," is concise and captures the essence of the phrase, but it omits the full meaning of the original text. The second translation, "Stable and virtuous culture, with top-down influence and bottom-up emulation," is more comprehensive but uses "stable" instead of "sound" and adds "emulation" which is not explicitly in the original text. The third translation, "Sound and virtuous culture – leadership by example," is similar to the first but lacks the full context. The fourth translation, "Sound culture, sector to stability," is confusing and does not accurately reflect the original meaning. The fifth translation, "Stable and Virtuous Culture: Upper Level Leads, Lower Level Follows," is more accurate but uses "stable" instead of "sound" and is somewhat awkward in phrasing. The sixth translation, "Sound and Virtuous Culture: The Upper Levels Lead by Example, Influencing the Lower Levels," is the most comprehensive and accurate, capturing the full meaning of the original text.
Based on this review, the best possible translation would be one that accurately reflects the original meaning, uses the correct terms from the dictionary, and is fluent and natural in English. The translation should use "sound" for "穩" and "culture" for "文化," and it should convey the idea of leadership by example influencing all levels. The final translation should be concise, accurate, and natural in English.

In reviewing the six translations, several strengths and weaknesses emerge. All translations capture the core message of the original text, which is the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) efforts to regulate bank conduct and promote a sound banking culture. However, there are notable differences in fluency, accuracy, and adherence to the dictionary terms.
Strengths include the consistent use of "Bank Conduct Department" and "HKMA" as the correct translations for "銀行操守部" and "金管局," respectively. The translations also generally convey the intent of promoting fair treatment of customers and strengthening consumer protection. The use of "sound culture" and "three pillars" is accurate and aligns with the dictionary's suggested translations for "穩善文化" and "三大支柱."
Weaknesses include inconsistencies in the translation of terms like "推動" (promote, drive, encourage, etc.) and "評估" (assessment, self-assessment, evaluation). Some translations use "promote" consistently, while others use "drive" or "encourage," which may not always be the best fit. Additionally, the phrase "標本兼治" is translated as "both symptomatic and root-cause solutions" or "both symptoms and root causes," which is accurate but could be more concise.
The term "全港" is translated as "across all 18 districts of Hong Kong" in one translation, which is overly specific and not necessary. The dictionary provides "Territory-Wide" as an alternative, which is more appropriate and concise.
The phrase "三大支柱" is translated as "three pillars" in all translations, which is correct. However, the use of "sound bank culture" is more consistent than "sound banking culture" or "sound culture."
The term "落實" is translated as "implementation" or "implementing," which is accurate. However, "put in place" or "operationalising" could also be considered, though "implementation" is the most common and natural choice.
The phrase "上行下效" is translated as "lead by example" or "permeates from top to bottom," which captures the intended meaning. However, "lead by example" is more concise and natural in English.
The term "自我評估" is consistently translated as "self-assessment," which is correct.
In terms of fluency and grammar, all translations are generally well-written, but some use passive voice unnecessarily, which can make the text feel less direct. For example, "the HKMA further introduced regulatory measures on bank culture" is more direct than "regulatory measures on bank culture were further introduced."
Overall, the best translation would combine the strengths of all six, ensuring consistency in terminology, fluency, and accuracy. It would use "promote" for "推動," "self-assessment" for "自我評估," and "sound culture" for "穩善文化." It would also avoid overly specific translations like "across all 18 districts of Hong Kong" and use "Territory-Wide" instead.
The final translation should be concise, accurate, and natural in English, while adhering strictly to the dictionary terms provided.
Here is the improved translation:
In terms of regulating the conduct of banks, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority established the Banking Conduct Department in 2010 to promote fair treatment of customers and strengthen consumer protection. To address both symptoms and root causes, in addition to setting out various regulatory requirements targeting the basic conduct of bank operations, we have vigorously promoted reforms in banking culture in recent years, encouraging banks to promote a sound culture through governance, reward systems, and assessment and feedback mechanisms. We aim to ensure that good conduct permeates from top to bottom within banks, fundamentally restoring and enhancing customers’ trust and respect for banks. Following the provision of specific guidelines to all banks in Hong Kong in 2017, the HKMA further introduced regulatory measures on banking culture by the end of 2018, including requiring banks to conduct self-assessments on corporate culture and the implementation of related measures, enabling the three pillars of a sound banking culture to be effectively implemented.

Although the internet and mobile finance are global trends, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continued to promote inclusive finance last year, meeting the needs of communities unable to adopt new technologies. For example, we collaborated with the Hong Kong Association of Banks to drive the launch of elderly-friendly cash withdrawal services at convenience stores through the "Electronic Payment Services" platform, with the convenience store network expanding to over 300 stores. We also contacted Hong Kong Post to introduce the "Elderly Cash Withdrawal" service at seven major post offices located in outlying islands and the New Territories. The banking industry responded to the HKMA's recommendations by actively increasing barrier-free facilities and providing inclusive banking services for people with disabilities and the general public. One example is the number of voice-guided ATMs, which increased more than tenfold within a year to over 700 units. Additionally, under the HKMA's active promotion, we expect banks to gradually establish more physical branches in remote areas and introduce mobile banking services, enhancing convenience for the public.

# Smart Banking: A New Experience

The six translations provided by junior translators are generally accurate and convey the core message of the original text. However, there are notable differences in fluency, terminology consistency, and adherence to the dictionary guidelines. Here is a critical review and reasoning for producing the best possible translation:
**Strengths:**
- All translations correctly identify key terms such as "金管局" (Hong Kong Monetary Authority), "轉數快" (FPS), and "共用二維碼" (shared QR code).

**Weaknesses:**
- Some translations use "fintech" without fully justifying it in context, while others use "financial technology" more consistently.

**Reasoning for Best Translation:**
To produce the best possible translation, we should:
- Use "financial technology" consistently for "金融科技" unless "fintech" is more natural in context.
- Use "the public" for "市民" to maintain a formal tone.
- Translate "短短半年" as "in just half a year" for conciseness.
- Use "2.58 million" instead of "2.58 million accounts" to match the original's "萬個."
- Use "average daily transaction volume" for "日均交易量."
- Ensure that all dictionary terms are translated using the most appropriate and contextually accurate English alternatives.
**Improved Translation:**
The Hong Kong Monetary Authority closely collaborated with banks and the technology industry to launch the "Smart Banking New Era" in September 2017, promoting the development and innovation of Hong Kong's financial technology and offering the public a brand-new experience in payment and banking services. The highlight of 2018 was undoubtedly the official launch of the "Faster Payment System" (FPS) in September. It is a globally unique retail fast payment system that breaks down barriers between various electronic payment tools and bank accounts in Hong Kong, allowing the public to enjoy 24/7 real-time fund transfers in Hong Kong dollars and renminbi. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also simultaneously launched the world's first "shared QR code" standard and application, enabling merchants to connect to multiple electronic payment systems through a single QR code. Since its launch, FPS has been widely welcomed by the public. In just half a year, registration records have exceeded 2.58 million, with an average daily transaction volume of 60,000 transactions, averaging 20,700 Hong Kong dollars and 38,000 renminbi per transaction respectively.

In May last year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued guidelines for the authorization of virtual banks, followed by 33 institutions submitting applications for virtual bank licenses. As of mid-April this year, four licenses have already been issued, and they are expected to officially commence operations within the year. Virtual banks help promote the development and innovation of Hong Kong's financial technology, providing individuals and small and medium-sized enterprises with new services and experiences, and promoting financial inclusion.

In addition, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) released an Open API framework in July. Banks will open external interfaces for their products and services in four phases, creating a more flexible and open fintech environment, enabling bank customers to more conveniently integrate account information, obtain information, and select services that better meet their needs. Throughout the year, a total of 42 new technology products used the HKMA’s fintech regulatory sandbox for testing, among which 28 completed trials, and the related products and services have already been successfully launched into the market.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA), in collaboration with multiple banks, officially launched "eTradeConnect" in October last year. This trade financing platform, which adopts "distributed ledger technology," will enhance the efficiency of banks in approving trade financing. "eTradeConnect" is currently testing connections with related platforms in other regions to promote cross-border trade financing activities.

Fintech has not only been widely applied in daily life, but in recent years it has also entered the fields of compliance and regulation. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority encourages banks to use compliance technology (Regtech) to assist in handling day-to-day operations, such as monitoring suspicious activities related to money laundering and the financing of terrorism. At the same time, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is studying the use of supervisory technology (Suptech) to further enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of regulatory work.

# Consolidate and Enhance Financial Strength

The competition between international financial centres is a contest of soft power. We must continuously adapt to changes in economic, social, and technological development, seize opportunities, and constantly open up new areas of development for Hong Kong's financial sector. Green finance represents a significant opportunity for Hong Kong to develop its bond and project financing markets. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority supports and collaborates with the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government in developing green finance. In addition to supporting the Government's preparatory work for the issuance plan of HKD 1,000 billion in government green bonds, we held multiple green finance seminars last year, including two large-scale international conferences, to enhance the market's understanding, awareness, and participation in green finance, and to encourage issuing institutions to participate in the Government's green bond subsidy scheme launched last year and the green finance certification service in Hong Kong. The amount of green bonds issued in Hong Kong last year exceeded USD 11 billion, which is more than three times that of 2017.

In recent years, the investment community has shown growing interest in infrastructure and related projects. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office (IFFO) in 2016. The number of its collaborating partners has more than doubled to 95 institutions, making it an important platform for exchange in infrastructure financing within the region. Last year, the HKMA co-hosted its first high-level roundtable meeting with the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission (SASAC) of the State Council, discussing Hong Kong's unique advantages and role in supporting central state-owned enterprises' "going global" initiatives. This laid a solid foundation for future collaborative expansion of development opportunities between central state-owned enterprises and Hong Kong's financial and professional services sectors.

# 2018 Calendar of Events

# Currency Stability

# April 12

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking at an exchange rate of 7.85 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar was triggered during the London trading session. This is the first time since the HKMA introduced three initiatives to optimize the Linked Exchange Rate System in 2005 that the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking has been triggered. In 2018, the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking was triggered a total of 27 times.

# July 24

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and three note-issuing banks announced the launch of the 2018 Hong Kong new series banknotes.

# October 26

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority announced the designation of nine authorized institutions as primary liquidity providers in Hong Kong's offshore renminbi market.

# Banking System

# January 10

The original text is a formal announcement regarding a policy change by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). The key elements are the date (2019年1月1日), the entity (金管局), the policy (逆周期緩衝資本), and the change (由1.875%上調至2.5%).
**Review of Junior Translations:**
1. **First junior translator:** The translation is accurate and fluent. It uses "HKMA" and "countercyclical buffer capital" correctly. The phrase "effective from January 1, 2019" is natural. However, "was increased" implies a past action, which may not align with the formal tone of the original.
2. **Second junior translator:** This translation uses "announces" and "adjusted upwards," which are appropriate. However, "effective from January 1, 2019" is slightly awkward compared to "effective January 1, 2019." Also, "Hong Kong's" may be redundant if the subject is already clear.
3. **Third junior translator:** The translation is accurate and natural. "Has been increased to 2.5% from 1.875%" is a clear and formal expression. However, the structure "applicable to Hong Kong" is slightly less precise than "applicable in Hong Kong."
4. **Fourth junior translator:** The use of "will increase" introduces a future tense, which may not match the original's tone of a completed policy change. "Applicable to Hong Kong" is slightly less precise than "applicable in Hong Kong."
5. **Fifth junior translator:** This translation is accurate and natural. "Will be raised" is appropriate for a policy change. However, "starting from" is slightly informal compared to "effective from."
6. **Sixth junior translator:** The use of "published" is less appropriate than "announces" or "announced" in this context. "Adjusted upwards" is correct, but "effective January 1, 2019" is slightly awkward.
**Reasoning for Best Translation:**
The best translation should use "announced" to reflect the formal nature of the announcement, "effective January 1, 2019" for clarity, and "adjusted upwards" or "raised" to reflect the policy change. "Applicable in Hong Kong" is more precise than "applicable to Hong Kong." The use of "from 1.875% to 2.5%" is clear and concise.
**Improved Translation:**
The Hong Kong Monetary Authority announced that, effective January 1, 2019, the countercyclical buffer capital applicable in Hong Kong will be raised from 1.875% to 2.5%.

# February 2nd

The original text is a formal legal notice announcing the gazetting of a revised ordinance related to anti-money laundering and counter-financing of terrorism. The dictionary provides specific translations for key terms, and the junior translators have attempted to render the text into English, though with varying degrees of accuracy and fluency.
**Review of Translations:**
1. **First junior translator:** The translation is mostly accurate but uses "Ordinance to Amend the 2018 Ordinance" which is redundant and awkward. The term "Countering" is not in the dictionary, and "counter-financing" is not the best fit for "籌集" in this context.
2. **Second junior translator:** This translation is more concise and uses "Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism" which aligns with the dictionary. However, "Amendment" is placed incorrectly, and the structure is slightly off.
3. **Third junior translator:** The use of "Combat" is not in the dictionary, and "Combat" is not a direct translation of "打擊." The placement of "2018" at the end is also unconventional in legal terminology.
4. **Fourth junior translator:** The translation is concise but lacks proper capitalization and structure. "Amendment Ordinance" is not the standard legal phrasing.
5. **Fifth junior translator:** This is the most accurate and fluent translation. It correctly uses "Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism" and places "Amendment" appropriately. However, "is gazetted" is less formal than "has been gazetted."
6. **Sixth junior translator:** This translation is the least accurate. It uses lowercase for "anti-money laundering" and "financial institutions," which is not standard in legal documents. Also, "revised" is not the best fit for "修訂" in this context.
**Reasoning for Best Translation:**
The best translation should:
- Use "2018" as a prefix, as it is a year and typically placed at the beginning.
- Use "Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism" as per the dictionary.
- Use "Amendment" as a noun, not a verb.
- Use "Ordinance" with proper capitalization.
- Use "has been gazetted" for formality and accuracy.
**Improved Translation:**
The 2018 Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism (Financial Institutions) (Amendment) Ordinance has been gazetted.

# February 28
The original text is a simple date: "2月28日," which translates to "February 28" in English. The dictionary provides several options for translating the characters "月" (month), "2" (2 or two), "日" (day, dates, or Day), and "28" (28). The space " " is to be translated as an empty string, meaning it should be omitted.
**Review of Junior Translations:**
1. **"February 28th"** – This is grammatically correct but adds an unnecessary "th" suffix, which is not standard in formal or neutral English date formats. It is more common to write "February 28" without the ordinal suffix unless specifying a particular day in a narrative context.
2. **" # 2月28日"** – This is a direct copy of the original text with a hashtag, which is not a proper English translation. It fails to translate the characters and retains the Chinese format.
3. **"February 28"** – This is a correct and concise translation. It uses the proper month name and numerical day format, which is standard in English.
4. **" # 2 month 28 day"** – This translation is awkward and overly literal. It uses "month" and "day" as separate words, which is not standard in English date formatting. The hashtag is also unnecessary.
5. **"two day 28"** – This is incorrect in both grammar and format. "Two day 28" is not a standard way to express a date in English and is confusing.
6. **"February 28"** – This is identical to the third translation and is correct.
**Reasoning for Best Translation:**
The best translation should be concise, grammatically correct, and follow standard English date formatting. "February 28" is the most appropriate choice as it uses the correct month name, numerical day format, and omits unnecessary elements like the ordinal suffix or literal translations of "month" and "day." It also adheres to the dictionary by using "February" for "月" and "28" for "28," while omitting the space as instructed.
**Final Translation:**
February 28

The original text discusses the Financial Stability Board's report on Hong Kong's progress in reforming the over-the-counter derivatives market and establishing a financial institution resolution framework. The junior translators have produced translations that are mostly accurate but vary in fluency, terminology, and adherence to the dictionary.
**Review of Translations:**
1. **First junior translator:** Uses "interbank review" and "establishment of financial institution resolution framework." The term "interbank review" is not in the dictionary, and "establishment" is not the best fit for "設立." The translation is fluent but not fully aligned with the dictionary.
2. **Second junior translator:** Uses "review report" and "establishing a framework for the resolution of financial institutions." "Review report" is not in the dictionary, and "resolution of financial institutions" is not the best match for "處置." The translation is accurate but slightly off in terminology.
3. **Third junior translator:** Uses "interbank assessment" and "financial institution resolution framework." "Interbank assessment" is not in the dictionary, but the rest is accurate. The translation is fluent and adheres well to the dictionary.
4. **Fourth junior translator:** Uses "peer review report" and "establishing a financial institution resolution framework." "Peer review report" is not in the dictionary, but the rest is accurate. The translation is fluent and natural.
5. **Fifth junior translator:** Uses "interbank peer review" and "set up of a framework for the resolution of financial institutions." "Interbank peer review" is not in the dictionary, and "set up" is not the best fit for "設立." The translation is accurate but slightly off in terminology.
6. **Sixth junior translator:** Uses "concerning Hong Kong" and "establishment of a financial institutions resolution framework." "Concerning" is not the best fit for "發出," and "financial institutions" should be singular. The translation is accurate but lacks fluency.
**Reasoning for Best Translation:**
The best translation should use the dictionary terms accurately, maintain fluency, and convey the intended meaning. The term "發出" should be translated as "published" or "issued." "確認" should be "recognising." "處置" should be "resolution." "設立" should be "establishing." "同業" should be "interbank." "報告" should be "report." "進展理想" should be "substantial progress."
**Improved Translation:**

# 金管局簡介

香港金融管理局是香港的中央銀行機構，主要職能有4項：在聯繫匯率制度的架構內維持貨幣穩定；促進金融體系（包括銀行體系）的穩定與健全；協助鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，包括維持與發展香港的金融基建；以及管理外匯基金。

# 金管局的法定授權

立法會（前稱立法局）於1992年通過《外匯基金條例》修訂條文，授權財政司司長（前稱財政司）委任金融管理專員，金管局隨後在1993年4月1日成立。

金融管理專員的權力、職能及責任由《外匯基金條例》、《銀行業條例》、《金融機構（處置機制）條例》、《存款保障計劃條例》、《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》及其他有關條例明文規定。財政司司長與金融管理專員於2003年6月25日的互換函件，列載彼此在貨幣與金融事務方面的職能與責任的分配，亦披露財政司司長將若干權力轉授金融管理專員。有關函件為公開文件，可於金管局網站查閱。

外匯基金根據《外匯基金條例》設立，由財政司司長掌有控制權。該條例規定外匯基金須主要運用於影響港元匯價。財政司司長亦可運用外匯基金以保持香港貨幣金融體系的穩定與健全，藉此保持香港作為國際金融中心的地位。

金融管理專員根據《外匯基金條例》委任，以協助財政司司長執行其根據該條例獲授予的職能，以及執行其他條例及財政司司長所指派的職能。金融管理專員的辦公室稱為金管局，金融管理專員即為金管局總裁。

金融管理專員根據《銀行業條例》賦予的職責及權力，規管及監管銀行業務與接受存款業務。根據《銀行業條例》，金融管理專員負責處理香港持牌銀行、有限制牌照銀行及接受存款公司的認可資格事宜。

《金融機構（處置機制）條例》指定金融管理專員為銀行界實體的處置機制當局。該條例賦予金融管理專員一系列權力，對有關實體進行有秩序處置，以減低有關實體不可持續經營對香港金融體系的穩定及有效運作構成的風險。

《證券及期貨條例》及《強制性公積金計劃條例》賦予金融管理專員若干有關銀行證券及強制性公積金業務的權力。

《保險業條例》訂明可就銀行的保險業務向金融管理專員轉授查察及調查權力。

《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集條例》賦權金融管理專員監管銀行遵守該條例的規定。

《存款保障計劃條例》授予金融管理專員責任，就存款保障計劃的運作提供協助，以及啟動從存款保障計劃基金向無力償付銀行的存款人發放補償。

金融管理專員在《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》的法定架構下，可指定及監察對香港貨幣或金融穩定或對香港發揮作為國際金融中心的功能事關重要的結算及交收系統。該條例亦授權金融管理專員管理儲值支付工具發牌制度，及指定零售支付系統並監察該等系統的運作是否安全及有效率。

# 金管局與香港特別行政區政府

金管局是香港特別行政區政府架構的一部分，但可以按與公務員不同的聘用條款聘請員工，以吸引具適當經驗與專門知識的人才。金管局總裁及其員工均為公職人員。金管局的日常運作，在金融管理專員所獲賦予或轉授的法定權力範圍內高度自主。

財政司司長負責釐定香港的貨幣政策目標及貨幣體制：財政司司長於2003年6月25日致金融管理專員的函件中，訂明應透過貨幣發行局制度維持貨幣穩定，將港元匯率保持在約7.80港元兌1美元的水平。金融管理專員須自行負責達成貨幣政策目標，包括決定有關的策略、工具及執行方式，並負責維持香港貨幣制度的穩定與健全。

財政司司長在財經事務及庫務局局長的協助下，負責維持香港金融體系穩定與健全，以及保持香港的國際金融中心地位的政策。為推行這些政策，金融管理專員的職責包括：
- 促進銀行體系的整體穩定與有效運作
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，發展債務市場
- 處理與法定紙幣及硬幣的發行及流通有關的事宜
- 透過發展支付、結算及交收系統，以及在適當情況下負責操作有關系統，促進金融基建的安全與效率
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，促進對香港貨幣及金融體系的信心，並推行適當的發展市場措施，以協助加強香港金融服務的國際競爭力。

外匯基金由財政司司長掌有控制權。金融管理專員須根據財政司司長轉授的權力，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 問責性與透明度

就日常運作及推行政府政策目標所採用的方法，金管局一直保持高度自主，並同時輔以高問責性及透明度。

金管局致力促進貨幣與銀行體系穩定，有效管理官方儲備，發展與監察穩健及多元化的金融基建，從而鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，推動香港經濟發展。

金管局要有效履行職責，便必須取得社會人士的信心。因此，金管局以嚴謹的態度，履行向公眾解釋其政策及工作的責任，並盡力處理社會上備受關注而涉及金管局職責範圍的事項。

金融管理專員由財政司司長委任，因此金管局透過財政司司長向公眾負責；而由於金管局的職權由立法會通過的法律制訂，因此金管局亦透過立法會向公眾負責。此外，金管局亦明白本身肩負更廣泛的責任，就是促進公眾對金管局角色及目標的認識，並密切留意社會人士所關注的事項。金管局在執行日常工作及與社會保持廣泛聯繫時，堅守盡力提高透明度及保持開放的政策。這項政策有兩大目標：
- 在顧及市場敏感性、商業秘密及機密資料披露的法定限制下，盡量使金融界及公眾充分了解金管局的工作；
- 確保金管局掌握社會脈搏，並對公眾意見作出適當回應。

金管局在透明度方面致力達致國際最高標準，與傳媒保持廣泛聯繫之餘，亦出版各種中英文期刊及專題刊物。金管局的雙語網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)除有專門環節列載經濟研究、統計資料、消費者資訊及其他課題外，還載有金管局出版的刊物、新聞稿、演辭及簡報會資料文件。此外，金管局又利用社交媒體平台，以能在數碼時代中更有效與公眾溝通。金管局辦事處設有資訊中心，分為圖書館及展覽館兩部分，每星期開放6日予公眾參觀及使用。金管局亦舉辦公眾教育活動，透過講座及資訊中心導賞服務，向公眾人士（特別是學生）講解金管局的工作，以及增進市民的金融知識。有關金管局的傳媒聯繫工作、刊物及公眾教育活動的詳細資料，見「機構職能」一章。

金管局公布外匯基金及貨幣發行局帳目資料的次數，一直逐步增加，內容亦越趨詳細。金管局於1999年開始參與國際貨幣基金組織的中央銀行「數據公布特殊標準」計劃。金管局亦公布外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄，以及貨幣發行局制度運作報告。自1996年起，金管局網站亦載有銀行業監管政策及指引。

金管局與立法會的關係對提高問責性及透明度非常重要。金管局總裁承諾每年3次向立法會財經事務委員會簡報金管局各項工作及政策，並回答有關查詢。此外，金管局代表亦會不時出席立法會財經事務委員會及法案委員會會議，闡釋及商討特別事項，以及協助議員審閱條例草案。

# 諮詢委員會及其他委員會

# 外匯基金諮詢委員會

財政司司長行使外匯基金的控制權時，會聽取外匯基金諮詢委員會的意見。外匯基金諮詢委員會根據《外匯基金條例》第3(1)條成立。該項條文訂明財政司司長行使對外匯基金的控制權時，須諮詢外匯基金諮詢委員會的意見。財政司司長為外匯基金諮詢委員會的當然主席，其他委員（包括金融管理專員）則以個人身分，由財政司司長根據香港特別行政區行政長官的授權委任。委員因各具專業知識及經驗而獲委任，他們的加入讓外匯基金諮詢委員會廣受裨益。委員的專業知識及經驗涵蓋貨幣、金融、經濟、投資、會計、管理、商業及法律等範疇。

外匯基金諮詢委員會下設5個專責委員會，負責監察金管局特定環節的工作，並透過外匯基金諮詢委員會向財政司司長報告及提出建議。外匯基金諮詢委員會在2018年共舉行5次會議，討論各項與金管局工作有關的事宜，其中大部分事項均由有關的專責委員會事先進行討論。

管治委員會監察金管局的表現，以及就金管局薪酬與服務條件、人力資源政策、財政預算、行政及管治事務，向外匯基金諮詢委員會提出建議。該委員會在2018年共召開5次會議，內容涵蓋金管局的開支預算、表現評估、年度薪酬檢討及策略性規劃事宜。該委員會亦審議金管局定期提交的工作報告。

審核委員會檢討金管局的財政匯報程序，並評核其內部管控制度是否足夠和有效，以及提交報告。審核委員會負責檢視金管局的財務報表，編製該等報表的組成項目與會計原則，並聯同外部及內部審計師查核其審計範疇與結果。審核委員會各委員在金管局並沒有任何行政職能。該委員會在2018年共召開2次會議，並審議風險委員會及內部審核處的工作報告。

貨幣發行委員會監察貨幣發行局制度的運作，並匯報這個作為香港聯繫匯率制度支柱的情況。該委員會負責確保貨幣發行局制度按照既定政策運作、提出改進該制度的建議，以及確保該制度的運作維持高透明度。金管局定期公布貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄及提交該委員會的貨幣發行局制度運作報告。該委員會在2018年共召開4次會議。

# Hong Kong Monetary Authority Overview

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is Hong Kong's central banking institution, with four main functions: maintaining currency stability within the framework of the Linked Exchange Rate System; promoting the stability and robustness of the financial system (including the banking system); assisting in consolidating Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre, including maintaining and developing Hong Kong's financial infrastructure; and managing the Exchange Fund.

# The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's Statutory Authorization

The Legislative Council (previously known as the Legislative Council) passed the amended provisions of the Exchange Fund Ordinance in 1992, authorizing the Financial Secretary (previously known as the Financial Secretary) to appoint the Monetary Authority. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority was subsequently established on April 1, 1993.

**Weaknesses:**

**Best Translation:**
The powers, functions, and responsibilities of the Monetary Authority are stipulated in the Exchange Fund Ordinance, the Banking Ordinance, the Financial Institutions (Resolution Mechanism) Ordinance, the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance, the Payment Systems and Stored Value Payment Tools Ordinance, and other relevant ordinances. The exchange of letters between the Financial Secretary and the Monetary Authority dated June 25, 2003, set out the allocation of their respective functions and responsibilities in monetary and financial affairs, and also disclosed that the Financial Secretary delegated certain powers to the Monetary Authority. The relevant letter is a public document and can be accessed on the HKMA website.

The Exchange Fund was established under the Exchange Fund Ordinance and is controlled by the Financial Secretary. The Ordinance stipulates that the Exchange Fund must primarily be used to affect the exchange rate of the Hong Kong dollar. The Financial Secretary may also use the Exchange Fund to maintain the stability and integrity of Hong Kong's monetary and financial system, thereby maintaining Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre.

The Monetary Authority is appointed under the Exchange Fund Ordinance to assist the Financial Secretary in performing the functions conferred upon him by that Ordinance, as well as other functions assigned by the Financial Secretary under other Ordinances. The Office of the Monetary Authority is known as the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA), and the Monetary Authority is the Governor of the HKMA.

The Monetary Authority, empowered by the Banking Ordinance, regulates and supervises banking operations and deposit-taking operations. Under the Banking Ordinance, the Monetary Authority is responsible for handling the authorization of licensed banks, restricted licence banks, and deposit-taking companies in Hong Kong.

The Financial Institutions (Resolution Regime) Ordinance designates the Monetary Authority as the resolution authority for banking sector entities. The Ordinance grants the Monetary Authority a series of powers to conduct an orderly resolution of the relevant entities, thereby mitigating the risks posed by the unsustainable operations of those entities to the stability and effective operations of Hong Kong’s financial system.

# 經濟及金融環境

2018年香港經濟持續擴張，不過隨着金融狀況收緊及貿易保護主義升溫令不明朗因素增加，增長動力於年內有所減弱。隨着全球經濟增長轉弱，預期2019年香港經濟增長亦會減慢。

# 經濟回顧

# 實體經濟活動

2018年香港經濟進一步擴張，不過按年增長速度由第1季的4.6%，逐步減慢至第4季的1.3%（表1），並拖累全年增長率由2017年的3.8%下降至3.0%。經濟擴張轉弱，反映本地需求增長減慢以及經濟持續受淨出口所拖累（圖1）。本地方面，私人消費在第1季強勁增長，但其後增長動力減弱，部分反映貿易保護主義升溫令不明朗因素增加，以及本地資產價格調整帶來的財富減值效應。由於營商信心脆弱，整體投資支出的增長速度亦放緩。外圍方面，貨品出口於首3季大致保持平穩，但在第4季隨着中美貿易摩擦加劇而顯著轉差。貨品進口亦因為出口帶動的需求轉弱而放緩。相比之下，服務輸出錄得較快的全年增長，部分是受惠於訪港旅遊業表現蓬勃，而服務輸入則由於運輸、商業及其他服務增長而得以大致維持增長動力。按淨額計，貿易差額由2017年的順差轉為2018年的小幅逆差，並拖累本地經濟增長。

表1 按開支項目計的實質本地生產總值增長（比對上期）

資料來源：政府統計處。

# 貨幣狀況

主要受到港元與美元負息差下的套息活動所影響，港元兌美元匯率在2018年大致回軟。尤其弱方兌換保證在4月、5月及8月被觸發，促使金管局按照聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）所定，在7.85港元兌1美元的水平，向銀行購入港元及沽出美元。按照聯匯制度的設計，港元貨幣基礎因而收縮，表示銀行同業流動性減少，再加上市場預期美國加息，導致港元銀行同業拆息整體上升。由於銀行體系資金成本上升，銀行於9月下旬在美國聯邦基金利率目標區間上調後，調高最優惠貸款利率12.5至25基點。信貸增長方面，部分由於本地經濟增長放緩以及對外貿易表現轉弱，整體銀行貸款的增幅由2017年的16.1%，顯著減慢至2018年的4.4%。

# 通脹

通脹壓力於2018年略為增加。剔除政府一次性紓緩措施的影響後，基本通脹率由2017年的1.7%低位，升至2018年的2.6%，不過仍屬於溫和水平。當中的住屋租金組成項目增幅較快，反映較早前新簽訂私人住宅租金上升的影響（圖2）。更廣泛的分析顯示，名義勞工成本及商用物業租金增長略為加快，令本地成本壓力更趨明顯。隨着香港部分主要進口來源地通脹上升，進口價格通脹亦因而攀升。

圖2 基本消費物價通脹
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 勞工市場

勞工市場狀況在2018年保持穩健（圖3）。失業率由2017年全年的3.1%下降至2018年的2.8%，是自1997年以來的最低水平。當中大部分主要服務行業的失業率都有所回落，特別是住宿及膳食服務業的跌幅更為顯著。隨着總就業人數及私營機構職位空缺進一步增加，整體勞工需求持續增強，而且勞動人口參與率亦輕微上升。在勞工市場狀況趨緊下，實質工資及收入進一步增加。

圖3 勞工市場狀況
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 股市

香港股市走勢在2018年大幅逆轉。恒生指數在2017年強勁的上升動力帶動下，於2018年1月升上33,484點的歷史高位（圖4）。然而，隨着主要中央銀行收緊貨幣政策、中美貿易摩擦加劇及本地經濟增長放緩引起投資者的憂慮，市場的樂觀情緒急劇逆轉。恒生指數在10月下挫至24,586點的低位，在年底則收報25,846點，較一年前下跌13.6%。然而，平均每日成交額則由2017年的882億港元上升至1,074億港元，本港首次公開招股集資總額亦因數間從事新興及創科產業的企業上市而大幅增加。

圖4 資產價格
資料來源：差餉物業估價署及香港交易及結算所有限公司。

# 物業市場

住宅物業市場在2018年上半年保持暢旺，不過在下半年隨着中美貿易摩擦加劇、環球股市調整及本港最優惠利率上升而有所降溫。整體樓價在7月至12月期間由高位回落9%，然而全年計仍錄得2%的升幅（圖4）。由於一手及二手市場的買賣活動於下半年顯著減少，所以物業成交量在2018年亦較前一年下跌7%至57,247宗。此外，置業負擔能力仍然偏緊，樓價與收入比率以及收入槓桿比率分別為17.0及75.7，兩者均遠高於長期平均水平。另一方面，非住宅物業價格在2018年整體上升，惟接近年底時稍見回落。全年計，價格及租金均進一步上升，租金回報率則維持在低位。

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

由於全球經濟增長放緩，預期2019年香港經濟增長將會減慢。尤其外圍環境充滿挑戰，預期香港出口表現仍會受壓。本地方面，雖然失業率低企及家庭收入增加將繼續支撐私人消費，但部分由於消費信心減弱及較早前的資產價格調整帶來的財富減值效應的影響，預期私人消費增長步伐會放緩。固定資本形成方面，雖然隨着房屋供應增加，樓宇及建造活動應會穩步增長，但面對經濟不明朗因素增加，企業對於資本投資可能會變得更為審慎。政府預測2019年實質本地生產總值增長率介乎2至3%之間，私營機構分析員的最新預測增幅則平均為2.3%。

# 通脹及勞工市場

由於包括香港在內的全球增長放緩，外圍物價及本地成本壓力或會得到紓緩，因此預期通脹壓力在2019年仍保持溫和。近期新簽訂住宅租金回落，亦會對通脹產生壓抑作用。市場共識預測2019年整體通脹率為2.2%，政府預期基本通脹率則為2.5%。預期在經濟持續增長及訪港旅遊業維持暢旺下，勞工市場狀況會繼續偏緊。私營機構分析員預計失業率於2019年會維持於約3%的水平。

# 不明朗因素及風險

2019年經濟前景受貿易摩擦、美國貨幣政策未來方向、內地經濟表現、英國脫歐及其他地緣政治局勢等不明朗因素及風險所影響。另外，一旦上述的不明朗因素加劇並長期持續，金融市場情緒及營商信心或會大受影響，對本地資產市場及實體經濟活動構成下行壓力。

另外，住宅物業市場受眾多外圍及本地因素所影響，其前景並不明朗。外圍方面，中美貿易摩擦的不確定性將有可能影響市場情緒、經濟前景及金融狀況，使香港物業市場前景繼續蒙上陰影。本地方面，雖然經濟增長放緩，但就業情況及收入增長仍大致穩定，或可支持住宅物業需求。本港利率的走勢某程度上視乎美國未來的政策利率變動，惟後者走勢並不明確。長遠而言，由於過去幾年住宅落成量有所增加，加上政府致力增加土地及房屋供應，預期房屋供求缺口或會收窄。

2018年銀行體系繼續穩步增長，資產負債表擴大5.9%。面對經濟不明朗因素持續，例如主要經濟體之間的貿易衝突及加息等，企業在獲取新貸款方面變得較為保守。年內貸款總額增幅放緩至4.4%，而2017年為16.1%。有關增長受在香港使用的貸款（+6.5%）及在香港境外使用的貸款（+2%）同告增加帶動。另一方面，由於環球貿易環境不明朗，貿易融資下跌7.6%。中國內地相關貸款的增長亦由2017年的17.5%放緩至2018年的1.4%。

銀行體系持有的債務證券總額在2018年底繼續佔總資產的22%，與2017年一樣。由於這些債務證券大部分為政府及銀行發行的投資級別債務證券，因此有關信用風險維持在低水平。

就負債方而言，存款總額在2018年增加5%，較2017年（+8.7%）的增幅小。由於預期美國持續加息，部分銀行上調定期存款利率，吸引存戶將往來及儲蓄存款轉為定期存款，從而鎖定資金。往來及儲蓄存款佔存款總額的比例由對上一年的57.4%，降至2018年底的51.4%，導致資金成本上升。由於存款總額的增長較貸款總額快，整體貸存比率由2017年底的73%稍降至2018年底的72.6%（圖5）。

# Economic and Financial Environment

In 2018, Hong Kong's economy continued to expand, although growth momentum weakened during the year as financial conditions tightened and rising trade protectionism increased uncertainty. With global economic growth softening, Hong Kong's economic growth is also expected to slow in 2019.

# Economic Review

# Physical Economic Activities

In 2018, Hong Kong's economy continued to expand, but the year-on-year growth rate gradually slowed from 4.6% in the first quarter to 1.3% in the fourth quarter (Table 1), dragging the full-year growth rate down from 3.8% in 2017 to 3.0%. The weakening economic expansion reflected a slowdown in local demand growth and the continued drag from net exports (Chart 1). Locally, private consumption grew strongly in the first quarter, but its growth momentum weakened afterward, partly reflecting increased uncertainty due to rising trade protectionism and the wealth impairment effects from local asset price adjustments. Due to fragile business confidence, the growth rate of overall investment spending also slowed. Externally, goods exports remained broadly stable in the first three quarters, but significantly deteriorated in the fourth quarter as US-China trade tensions intensified. Goods imports also slowed due to weaker demand driven by exports. In contrast, service exports recorded faster full-year growth, partly benefiting from the robust performance of inbound tourism, while service imports maintained growth momentum largely due to growth in transport, business, and other services. On a net basis, the trade balance turned from a surplus in 2017 to a small deficit in 2018, dragging down local economic growth.

Mainly affected by carry trade activities under the negative interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate against the US dollar broadly softened in 2018. In particular, the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking was triggered in April, May, and August, prompting the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) to purchase Hong Kong dollars and sell US dollars at a level of HK$7.85 to 1 US dollar, in accordance with the Linked Exchange Rate System (LERS). With inflation rising in some of Hong Kong's major import source countries, import price inflation also rose accordingly.

# Economic Prospects

# Economic Environment

Due to the global economic slowdown, it is expected that Hong Kong's economic growth in 2019 will slow down. In particular, the external environment remains challenging, and Hong Kong's export performance is still expected to face pressure. Locally, although low unemployment rates and increased household income are expected to continue supporting private consumption, the growth of private consumption is anticipated to moderate due to weakened consumer confidence and the lingering effects of wealth impairment from earlier asset price adjustments. In terms of fixed capital formation, while housing supply increases should lead to steady growth in building and construction activities, businesses may become more prudent in their capital investment decisions in the face of heightened economic uncertainty. The Government forecasts that the real local GDP growth rate in 2019 will range between 2% and 3%, while the average growth rate predicted by private sector analysts is 2.3%.

# Inflation and the Labour Market

Owing to the slowdown in global growth, including Hong Kong, external price and local cost pressures are expected to ease, thus inflationary pressures are expected to remain moderate in 2019. Recent declines in newly signed residential rental rates are also expected to exert a dampening effect on inflation. The market consensus forecasts the overall inflation rate in 2019 to be 2.2%, while the government expects the core inflation rate to be 2.5%. It is expected that, under sustained economic growth and continued strong inbound tourism, the labor market conditions will remain tight. Private sector analysts expect the unemployment rate to remain at around 3% in 2019.

# Uncertainty Factors and Risks

The 2019 economic outlook is affected by uncertainties and risks including trade tensions, the future direction of US monetary policy, Mainland China's economic performance, Brexit, and other geopolitical situations. Additionally, if the aforementioned uncertainties intensify and continue in the long term, financial market sentiment and business confidence may be significantly affected, exerting downward pressure on local asset markets and the physical economy.

In addition, the residential property market is influenced by numerous external and local factors, with its outlook remaining uncertain. Externally, the uncertainty surrounding US-China trade tensions could affect market sentiment, economic prospects, and financial conditions, continuing to cast a shadow over the outlook for Hong Kong's property market. Locally, although economic growth has slowed, employment conditions and income growth remain broadly stable, which could provide some support for residential property demand. The trajectory of Hong Kong interest rates to some extent depends on future policy rate changes in the US, though the latter's trajectory remains unclear. In the long term, due to increased residential completions over the past few years, combined with the government's efforts to increase land and housing supply, the housing supply-demand gap is expected to narrow.

# Banking Sector Performance

Despite the increase in external adverse factors, such as the US-China trade conflict, Brexit, and interest rate normalization, which intensified financial market volatility, the Hong Kong banking system remained resilient in 2018. The banking system's capital and liquidity conditions remained sound, with asset quality maintaining good levels. Rising interest rates widened interest margins, stimulating a significant increase in bank profits.

# Liquidity Conditions

The banking system's liquidity conditions remained resilient, reflecting its strong capacity to effectively withstand shocks from potential financial and economic pressures. In terms of short-term liquidity (covering one-month term funds), the average liquidity coverage ratio for Category 1 institutions was 167.6% in the fourth quarter, significantly higher than the statutory minimum requirement of 90% applicable in 2018. # 貨幣穩定

2018年港元利率普遍上升，而港元現貨匯率則回軟，並貼近弱方兌換保證匯率的水平。儘管如此，港元外匯及貨幣市場運作仍然暢順有序。聯繫匯率制度是香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石，並繼續展現其承受強大衝擊的能力。

# 目標

香港貨幣政策的主要目標是維持貨幣穩定，即確保港元匯價穩定，使港元在外匯市場兌美元的匯率保持在7.75至7.85港元兌1美元的區間內。該貨幣體制主要採用貨幣發行局制度，規定由外匯基金所持的美元儲備向貨幣基礎提供最少百分之百的支持；貨幣基礎若有變動，美元儲備亦必須作出相應增減，與貨幣基礎的變動百分之百配合。

貨幣基礎（表1）包括：
- 負債證明書（為3間發鈔銀行發行的銀行紙幣提供十足支持）
- 政府發行的流通紙幣及硬幣
- 銀行在金管局所持結算戶口的結餘總額（即總結餘）
- 金管局代表政府發行的外匯基金票據及債券。

金管局透過自動利率調節機制及履行兌換保證的堅決承諾來維持港元匯率的穩定。若市場對港元的需求大過供應，令市場匯率轉強至7.75港元兌1美元的強方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行沽出港元、買入美元，使總結餘增加及港元利率下跌，從而令港元匯率從強方兌換保證匯率水平回復至7.75到7.85的兌換範圍內。相反，若港元供過於求，令市場匯率轉弱至7.85港元兌1美元的弱方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行買入港元，使總結餘減少及推高港元利率，港元匯率隨之由弱方兌換保證匯率水平回復至兌換範圍內。

# 2018年回顧

# 匯率穩定

在港元與美元負息差擴闊帶動套息活動的背景下，港元匯率自年初以來逐步轉弱。於4月12日，弱方兌換保證在2005年訂於7.85水平以來首度被觸發。全年計，弱方兌換保證在2018年合共被觸發27次，分別在4月被觸發13次，5月6次，以及8月8次。儘管如此，港元交易仍然暢順有序，港元匯率於4月中至9月中在弱方兌換保證匯率7.85附近徘徊（圖1）。其後港元匯率略為轉強，部分反映假期、季結及年結臨近，銀行同業流動性收緊，帶動部分套息交易平倉。同時，某程度上港元亦受到11月初股市氣氛好轉支持。整體而言，港元外匯市場在2018年全年正常運作。

圖1 2018年市場匯率

由於弱方兌換保證被觸發，總結餘與未償還外匯基金票據及債券總額由2017年底的12,268億港元，下降至2018年底的11,362億港元（圖2）。年內，金管局按照聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）的設計，應銀行要求於弱方兌換保證匯率7.85的水平，購入合共1,035億港元，總結餘因而由2017年底的1,798億港元下降至2018年底的764億港元。年內未償還外匯基金票據及債券總額沒有明顯變動。貨幣基礎仍然由外匯儲備提供十足支持。

於2018年底，總結餘與未償還外匯基金票據及債券總額為11,362億港元。

圖2 2018年總結餘及未償還外匯基金票據及債券

# 貨幣市場

由於觸發弱方兌換保證後銀行同業流動性減少，以及市場預期美國加息，香港銀行同業拆息在2018年內普遍上升。受新股集資活動相關的資金需求增加及季節性流動資金需求帶動，短期銀行同業拆息更出現較大波幅（圖3）。整體而言，短期銀行同業拆息在2018年大致維持在低於基本利率的水平。鑑於銀行體系資金成本上升，在9月下旬美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍上調後，銀行調高最優惠貸款利率12.5至25基點。

因應年內美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍4次合共上調100基點，由1.25至1.50厘上調至2.25至2.50厘，基本利率於3月22日、6月14日、9月27日及12月20日合共上調100基點，由1.75厘上調至2.75厘。基本利率的調整是按照2009年3月26日宣布的經修訂計算公式作出。按照該公式，基本利率定於美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍下限加50基點的水平，或隔夜與1個月香港銀行同業拆息的5天移動平均數的平均值水平，以兩者中較高者為準。

圖3 2018年香港銀行同業拆息

港元遠期匯率折讓在首4個月擴大，大致跟隨港元與美元息差的走勢，其中12個月港元遠期匯率點子在4月中達到負620點子（圖4）。其後隨着港元與美元的負息差收窄，港元遠期匯率折讓略為縮小，然後在第4季再度擴大。整體而言，香港貨幣市場繼續正常運作。貼現窗借貸由2017年的103億港元增至2018年的402億港元。

圖4 2018年美元兌港元遠期匯率點子

# 聯繫匯率制度

聯匯制度自1983年實施以來，直是維持香港貨幣及金融穩定的重要基石；並在多次區內以至全球金融危機考驗下，展現其承受強大衝擊的能力。由於港元轉弱，作為聯匯制度設計一部分的弱方兌換保證於4月、5月及8月被多次觸發。資金流出港元，是香港利率正常化的必經過程，亦是聯匯制度下的正常運作。為增進各界對有關操作及聯匯制度機制的了解，金管局致力向公眾闡釋聯匯制度的技術細節，並展示香港金融體系應對衝擊的能力。政府亦堅決維持聯匯制度。外匯及貨幣市場保持穩定，進一步鞏固公眾對政府的承擔，以及港元作為支付及保值貨幣的信心。國際貨幣基金組織在與香港進行2018年第四條磋商時，重申對聯匯制度的支持，並指出聯匯制度仍然是最適合香港的貨幣制度，是維持穩定的支柱，有助確保經濟持續增長、維持競爭力及促進龐大的金融服務業暢順運作。

鑑於穩健的銀行體系對聯匯制度的正常運作具關鍵作用，金管局繼續密切監察銀行的信用、流動性及利率風險管理，以及壓力測試結果，並維持對銀行的企業、物業相關及內地相關貸款的監管，以確保銀行體系具備承受衝擊的能力。銀行持有大量外匯基金票據及債券，可經貼現窗用作換取港元流動資金，為利率大幅波動的情況提供有效緩衝。金管局隨時準備透過調整外匯基金票據及債券的發行量以提供額外流動性，以應對資金可能急劇流出港元的情況。金管局亦提醒市民審慎管理市場及利率風險，並為可能出現的市場波動作好準備。

為提高貨幣發行局帳目的透明度，自1998年10月起，外匯基金已有部分資產被指定用作支持貨幣基礎。支持比率（即支持資產相對貨幣基礎的比率）於2018年在107.8至109.9%之間上落，並無觸及上限或下限。該比率於12月31日為109.9%（圖5）。在聯匯制度下，雖然已指定某些外匯基金資產作為支持組合，但外匯基金的全部資產均可用作支持港元匯率。外匯基金的龐大財政資源，能在面對突如其來的衝擊時為保障香港的貨幣及金融穩定提供強力後盾。

圖5 2018年支持比率每日變動

# 貨幣發行委員會

外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的貨幣發行委員會（貨幣發行委員會）負責監察和探討與香港貨幣及金融穩定有關的課題。在2018年，貨幣發行委員會探討的課題包括多國央行聯合退出非常規貨幣政策對在香港的境外銀行美元貸款供應造成的潛在影響、港元貨幣需求的利率敏感度，以及聯匯制度自3項優化措施以來的運作機制及理論。貨幣發行委員會會議紀錄及金管局向其呈交的貨幣發行局制度運作報告，均載於金管局網站。

# 研究

香港金融研究中心（研究中心）繼續支持貨幣政策、銀行業及金融範疇的研究工作。過去4年，研究中心更着重政策方面的研究，從所舉辦的研討會及訪問學者計劃尤其可見一斑。一方面，研究中心與主要中央銀行及政策研究機構合作，聯合舉辦更多政策相關的研討會。另一方面，在2016年推出專題研究學者計劃，支持更多與金管局政策制定相關的研究項目。

在2018年，研究中心合共邀請16位研究學者到訪，並發表了25份研究論文。年內研究中心亦舉辦了4場國際研討會：
- 於1月舉行的「第9屆中國經濟年度國際研討會」，主題為「中國房地產市場及其對經濟與金融穩定的影響」。研討會由研究中心、國務院發展研究中心市場經濟研究所及中國人民銀行金融研究所合辦，集中討論內地房地產市場相關的課題及風險。
- 於10月舉行由金管局及國際結算銀行合辦的「匯率與貨幣政策框架」研討會。研討會為國際結算銀行於香港的亞太區辦事處成立20周年的慶祝活動之一，旨在探討匯率在貨幣政策框架中的角色。
- 於11月舉行的「2018年中央銀行金融市場微結構的年度研討會」。研討會討論金融市場微結構理論研究、實證研究結果及近期發展相關的政策影響。
- 於11月舉行由金管局、歐洲中央銀行及美國聯邦儲備委員會合辦的「中國經濟的新時代」中國專家網絡研討會。研討會討論內地經濟正面對的迫切問題及其對全球經濟的影響，並特別着重與中央銀行決策者相關的政策議題。這是中國專家網絡研討會首次在歐洲以外地區舉行。

# Currency Stability

In 2018, Hong Kong dollar interest rates generally rose, while the spot exchange rate of the Hong Kong dollar softened and approached the level of the weak-side Convertibility Undertaking exchange rate. Nevertheless, the operation of the Hong Kong dollar's foreign exchange and currency markets remained smooth and orderly. The Linked exchange rate system is the cornerstone of Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability and continues to demonstrate its ability to withstand strong shocks.

# Objectives

The six translations provided by junior translators all capture the core meaning of the original text, but they vary in fluency, grammatical accuracy, and adherence to the dictionary terms. Here is a critical review of each:
1. **First junior translator**: The translation is clear and fluent, with correct use of terms like "Currency Board" and "monetary base." However, "provide at least full support" is slightly awkward and could be more natural as "provide at least 100% support."
2. **Second junior translator**: This version is very close to the best possible translation. It uses "Currency Board" and "Exchange Fund" correctly, and the phrasing "provide full backing" is natural. However, "make corresponding increase or decrease" is slightly awkward compared to "adjusted accordingly."
3. **Third junior translator**: This translation is accurate and fluent, with correct use of terms. It uses "100% support" and "fully matching the changes," which are natural and precise. However, the phrase "provide at least 100% support" is slightly redundant and could be simplified to "provide 100% support."
4. **Fourth junior translator**: This version has some grammatical issues, such as "Currency stability" (should be lowercase unless it's a title), and "required under which" is awkward. The phrase "supporting the percentage change" is unclear and not in line with the original meaning.
5. **Fifth junior translator**: This is a strong translation with natural phrasing and correct use of terms. It uses "100% alignment" and "adjusted accordingly," which are precise and fluent. However, "maintaining a 100% alignment" could be slightly more natural as "maintaining a 100% correlation."
6. **Sixth junior translator**: This is very close to the best possible translation. It uses "100 percent support" and "maintaining a 100 percent correlation," which are accurate and natural. However, "increased or decreased accordingly" is slightly less concise than "adjusted accordingly."
**Reasoning for the best possible translation**:
- Use "Currency Board" as per the dictionary.
- Use "monetary stability" and "currency stability" appropriately, with "currency stability" being more precise in this context.
- Use "100% support" and "adjusted accordingly" for clarity and fluency.
- Ensure that "Exchange Fund" is used correctly and consistently.
- Use "monetary base" and "US dollar reserves" as per the dictionary.
- Ensure that the phrase "within the range of 7.75 to 7.85 Hong Kong dollars per 1 US dollar" is clear and natural.
**Improved Translation**:
The principal objective of Hong Kong's monetary policy is to maintain currency stability, that is, to ensure the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate, keeping the exchange rate of the Hong Kong dollar against the US dollar within a range of 7.75 to 7.85 Hong Kong dollars per 1 US dollar in the foreign exchange market. This monetary system mainly adopts the Currency Board system, which requires the US dollar reserves held by the Exchange Fund to provide at least 100% support for the monetary base; if the monetary base changes, the US dollar reserves must also be adjusted accordingly, maintaining a 100% correlation with changes in the monetary base.

Monetary Base (Table 1) includes:
- Certificates of Indebtedness (providing full backing for banknotes issued by three issuing banks)
- Circulating banknotes and coins issued by the Government
- The aggregate balance in settlement accounts held by banks with the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (i.e., total balance)
- Exchange Fund bills and bonds issued by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority on behalf of the Government.

The six translations provided by junior translators are generally accurate and convey the core meaning of the original text. However, they vary in fluency, precision, and adherence to the dictionary terms. Here is a critical review and reasoning for producing the best possible translation:
**Strengths:**
- All translations correctly identify the key terms and use the dictionary alternatives appropriately, such as "firm commitment," "Convertibility Undertaking," and "exchange rate range."
- The structure of the sentences is largely consistent with the original, and the explanations of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s (HKMA) actions are clear.
- The use of "aggregate balance" or "aggregate surplus" is consistent with the dictionary term "總結餘."
**Weaknesses:**
- Some translations use "total reserves" (e.g., Translation 4), which is not an exact match for "總結餘" and may mislead readers.
- The term "currency convertibility undertaking" (Translation 4) is not in the dictionary, and "Convertibility Undertaking" is the correct term.
- Some translations use "exchange guarantee" (e.g., Translation 6), which is not in the dictionary. The correct term is "Convertibility Undertaking."
- The phrase "strong-side Convertibility Undertaking exchange rate" is repeated in some translations, which is redundant and could be simplified to "strong-side exchange rate" or "strong-side Convertibility Undertaking rate."
- Some translations use "bringing the exchange rate back down" or "back up," which is acceptable but could be more neutral, such as "returning the exchange rate to the range."
**Improvements:**
- Use "Convertibility Undertaking" consistently as per the dictionary.
- Replace "total reserves" with "aggregate balance" or "aggregate surplus" as per the dictionary.
- Use more neutral and precise language, such as "returning the exchange rate to the range" instead of "bringing it back down/up."
- Ensure that the structure is clear and that the mechanism is explained logically without redundancy.
**Best Possible Translation:**
The Hong Kong Monetary Authority maintains the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate through its automatic interest rate adjustment mechanism and its firm commitment to fulfilling the Convertibility Undertaking. If market demand for the Hong Kong dollar exceeds supply, causing the market exchange rate to strengthen to the strong-side Convertibility Undertaking rate of 7.75 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar, the HKMA will sell Hong Kong dollars to banks and buy US dollars, increasing the aggregate balance and causing the Hong Kong dollar interest rate to fall, thereby returning the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate to the exchange rate range of 7.75 to 7.85. Conversely, if the supply of Hong Kong dollars exceeds demand, causing the market exchange rate to weaken to the weak-side Convertibility Undertaking rate of 7.85 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar, the HKMA will buy Hong Kong dollars from banks, decreasing the aggregate balance and driving up the Hong Kong dollar interest rate, thereby returning the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate to the exchange rate range.

# 2018 Review

# Exchange Rate Stability

Against the backdrop of the widening negative interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar, which has driven carry trade activities, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate has gradually weakened since the beginning of the year. On April 12, the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking, which had been set at a level of 7.85 since 2005, was triggered for the first time. For the whole year, the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking was triggered a total of 27 times in 2018, with 13 times in April, 6 times in May, and 8 times in August. Nevertheless, Hong Kong dollar transactions remained smooth and orderly, with the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate fluctuating around the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking rate of 7.85 between mid-April and mid-September (Chart 1). Subsequently, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate slightly strengthened, partly reflecting the tightening of interbank liquidity as holiday periods, quarter-end, and year-end approached, which triggered the unwinding of some carry trade positions. At the same time, to some extent, the Hong Kong dollar was also supported by the improved stock market sentiment in early November. Overall, the Hong Kong foreign exchange market operated normally throughout 2018.

Chart 1 2018 Market Exchange Rate

The best translation should accurately reflect the original text, use the dictionary terms correctly, and maintain natural English phrasing. The first, fourth, and fifth translations are all correct and natural. However, the first one is the most consistent in capitalization and structure, which is appropriate for a chart title.

# Currency Market

Due to the reduction in interbank liquidity following the triggering of the weak-side convertibility undertaking, as well as market expectations of U.S. interest rate hikes, Hong Kong interbank offered rates (HIBORs) generally rose throughout 2018. Driven by increased demand for funds related to new share issue fundraising activities and seasonal liquidity demand, short-term interbank offered rates experienced greater volatility (Chart 3). Overall, short-term interbank offered rates remained broadly below the basic interest rate level throughout 2018. In view of rising funding costs in the banking system, following the upward adjustment of the U.S. federal funds rate target range in late September, banks increased their most favorable loan rates by 12.5 to 25 basis points.

In response to four rate increases totaling 100 basis points within the year, the target range for the U.S. Federal Funds Rate was raised from 1.25 to 1.50 percent to 2.25 to 2.50 percent. The basic interest rate was raised a total of 100 basis points on March 22, June 14, September 27, and December 20, increasing from 1.75 percent to 2.75 percent. The adjustment of the basic interest rate was made in accordance with the revised calculation formula announced on March 26, 2009. According to this formula, the basic interest rate is set at the level of the lower bound of the U.S. Federal Funds Rate target range plus 50 basis points, or the average of the five-day moving average of the overnight and one-month Hong Kong interbank offered rates, whichever is higher.

# Linked Exchange Rate System

The Linked Exchange Rate System (LERS), implemented since 1983, has consistently served as a cornerstone for maintaining the stability of Hong Kong’s currency and financial system. It has demonstrated its ability to withstand significant shocks during multiple regional and global financial crises. Due to the weakening of the Hong Kong dollar, the Weak-side Convertibility Undertaking, which is part of the LERS design, was triggered multiple times in April, May, and August. The outflow of funds from the Hong Kong dollar is an inevitable process in the normalization of interest rates and is a normal operation under the LERS. To enhance public understanding of the operations and mechanisms of the LERS, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority has made concerted efforts to explain the technical details of the system to the public and to demonstrate the resilience of Hong Kong’s financial system in responding to shocks. The government has also firmly maintained the LERS. The foreign exchange and money markets have remained stable, further reinforcing public confidence in the government’s commitment and in the Hong Kong dollar as a medium of payment and store of value. During the 2018 Article IV consultation with Hong Kong, the International Monetary Fund reaffirmed its support for the LERS, noting that it remains the most suitable monetary system for Hong Kong, serving as a pillar of stability that helps ensure sustained economic growth, maintain competitiveness, and facilitate the smooth operation of the large-scale services sector.

In view of the critical role of a resilient banking system in the normal operation of the Linked Exchange Rate System, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to closely monitor banks' credit, liquidity, and interest rate risk management, as well as the results of stress tests, and maintains supervision over banks' corporate, property-related, and Mainland China-related loans to ensure the banking system has the capacity to withstand shocks. Banks hold a large amount of Exchange Fund bills and bonds, which can be used through the discount window to obtain Hong Kong dollar liquidity, providing an effective buffer against significant interest rate fluctuations. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is always prepared to adjust the issuance of Exchange Fund bills and bonds to provide additional liquidity in response to potential sharp outflows of funds from the Hong Kong dollar. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also reminds the public to prudently manage market and interest rate risks and to be prepared for potential market volatility.

To enhance the transparency of the Currency Board's accounts, since October 1998, part of the Exchange Fund's assets have been designated to support the monetary base. The support ratio (i.e., the ratio of supporting assets to the monetary base) fluctuated between 107.8% and 109.9% in 2018, without reaching the upper or lower limits. The ratio was 109.9% on December 31 (Chart 5). Under the Linked Exchange Rate System, although certain Exchange Fund assets have been designated as part of the support portfolio, all of the Exchange Fund's assets can be used to support the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. The Exchange Fund's vast financial resources can serve as a powerful backstop to safeguard Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability when facing sudden shocks.

# Currency Issuance Committee
The term "貨幣發行委員會" translates to "Currency Issuance Committee" when using the dictionary terms provided. The word "發行" is best translated as "issuance" in this context, as it refers to the act of issuing currency. "委員會" is translated as "Committee," which is the most appropriate term in this context. The use of "Currency" for "貨幣" is also appropriate as it refers to the general concept of money. The translations provided by the junior translators are mostly accurate, but "Currency Issue Committee" and "Currency issue Committee" are less precise than "Currency Issuance Committee." The use of "issuance" is more formal and appropriate for a committee that deals with the issuance of currency.

The original text discusses the responsibilities and activities of the Currency Issuance Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, focusing on topics related to Hong Kong’s currency and financial stability. The translations provided by junior translators vary in accuracy, fluency, and adherence to the dictionary terms.
**Review of Translations:**
1. **First Translation:** This version correctly identifies the "Currency Authority Committee" as a sub-committee of the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee. However, "Currency Authority Committee" is not an exact match for the original term, which is "貨幣發行委員會" (Currency Issuance Committee). The term "MAC" is not defined in the dictionary, and "Monetary Authority Committee" is not a standard term. The translation is fluent but misrepresents the committee's name.
2. **Second Translation:** This version uses "Currency Issuance Committee" correctly and aligns with the dictionary. However, "Currency Issuance Committee" is not a standard term in English financial contexts. The phrase "foreign banks" is used instead of "offshore banks," which is less precise. The term "enhancement initiatives" is acceptable, but "3 enhancement initiatives" should be "three enhancement initiatives" for consistency.
3. **Third Translation:** This version is the most accurate in terms of terminology and structure. It correctly uses "Currency Issuance Committee" and "Linked Exchange Rate System." The phrase "offshore banks" is appropriate. However, "theoretical basis" is slightly less precise than "theoretical frameworks" or "theoretical foundations."
4. **Fourth Translation:** This version incorrectly refers to the committee as the "Monetary Policy Division," which is not the correct term. The term "Monetary Policy Division" is not in the dictionary and is not an accurate translation of "貨幣發行委員會." The translation is fluent but misrepresents the committee's name.
5. **Fifth Translation:** This version correctly identifies the committee as the "Monetary Policy Division" but again misrepresents the name. It uses "USD loans" instead of "US dollar loans," which is acceptable but less formal. The phrase "three optimization measures" is correct, and the translation is fluent.
6. **Sixth Translation:** This version incorrectly refers to the committee as the "Currency Board Sub-Committee," which is not the correct term. The term "Currency Board" is used for "發行局" (Currency Board), not the committee itself. The translation is fluent but misrepresents the committee's name and structure.
**Reasoning for Best Translation:**
The third translation is the most accurate in terms of terminology and structure. It correctly identifies the committee as the "Currency Issuance Committee" and uses the appropriate terms from the dictionary. However, "Currency Issuance Committee" is not a standard term in English financial contexts. A more standard term would be "Currency Issuance Committee" or "Monetary Issuance Committee," but the dictionary does not provide an exact equivalent. Therefore, the best approach is to use the term "Currency Issuance Committee" as it is the closest match in the dictionary.
**Improved Translation:**
The Currency Issuance Committee, a sub-committee of the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, is responsible for monitoring and examining topics related to the stability of Hong Kong's currency and financial system. In 2018, the topics discussed by the Currency Issuance Committee included the potential impact of multiple central banks jointly exiting unconventional monetary policies on the supply of US dollar loans to offshore banks in Hong Kong, the interest rate sensitivity of the demand for Hong Kong dollars, and the operational mechanisms and theoretical frameworks of the Linked Exchange Rate System since the implementation of three optimization measures. The minutes of the Currency Issuance Committee meetings and the Currency Board system operation reports submitted to it by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority are all available on the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's website.

# Research

The Hong Kong Financial Research Centre (Research Centre) continues to support research on monetary policy, the banking sector, and financial areas. Over the past four years, the Research Centre has placed greater emphasis on policy-related research, as evidenced by the seminars it has hosted and the visiting scholars programme. On one hand, the Research Centre collaborates with major central banks and policy research institutions to jointly host more policy-related seminars. On the other hand, in 2016, it launched a specialized research scholars programme to support more research projects related to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's policy-making.

In 2018, the Research Centre invited a total of 16 research scholars to visit and published 25 research papers. During the year, the Research Centre also hosted four international conferences:
- The "9th China Economic Annual International Conference," held in January, with the theme "China's Real Estate Market and Its Impact on Economic and Financial Stability." The conference was jointly co-organised by the Research Centre, the Market Economy Research Institute of the State Council Development Research Centre, and the Financial Research Institute of the People's Bank of China, focusing on topics and risks related to the mainland's real estate market.
- The "Exchange Rate and Monetary Policy Framework" conference, held in October, jointly organised by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Bank for International Settlements. The conference was one of the celebratory events marking the 20th anniversary of the Bank for International Settlements' Asia-Pacific region office in Hong Kong, aiming to explore the role of exchange rates within the monetary policy framework.
- The "Annual Conference on Central Bank Financial Market Microstructure 2018," held in November. The conference discussed theoretical research, empirical findings, and policy implications related to recent developments in financial market microstructure.
- The "China Experts' Network Conference on China's New Era," held in November, jointly organised by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, the European Central Bank, and the US Federal Reserve. The conference discussed pressing issues facing the mainland economy and their impact on the global economy, with particular emphasis on policy issues relevant to central bank decision-makers. This was the first time the China Experts' Network Conference was held outside of Europe.

# 銀行體系穩定

儘管環球經濟及金融市場的不確定性增加，2018年香港銀行體系維持穩健。認可機構的流動性及信用風險管理制度的成效繼續是金管局年內的監管重點。鑑於網絡威脅持續增加，以及銀行業更廣泛使用金融科技，金管局加強對認可機構科技風險管理及業務操作恢復能力的監管。金管局亦於5月發出《虛擬銀行的認可》指引修訂本，並開始處理虛擬銀行認可申請。在操守監管方面，金管局採取進一步措施，加強監管認可機構銷售投資及保險產品的手法、促進為殘疾人士提供無障礙銀行服務，以及推動以客為本的企業文化。

隨着金融罪行越趨複雜及全球化，金管局繼續借助新科技及風險為本方法，加強香港打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集制度的應對能力。金管局在香港落實國際監管標準方面進展理想，其中包括資本充足標準、披露標準、流動性標準及大額風險承擔限額。此外，金管局亦加強與銀行業的溝通接觸，確保在監管成效與市場發展兩者間取得適當平衡。

與此同時，金管局繼續致力確保香港備有具公信力的認可機構處置機制，其中包括推出最低吸收虧損能力規定的規則，以解決認可機構處置可行性面對的一大障礙。

# 目標

金管局的整體目標之一是促進銀行體系的安全及穩定。要達致這個目標，實有賴建立及維持具高度應對能力且能為香港經濟提供所需關鍵金融服務的金融體系。

銀行可能因其營運方式，甚或在極端情況下因失序地倒閉而影響銀行體系的穩定。作為監管當局，金融管理專員在保障金融穩定方面擔當重要角色，確保銀行有能力抵禦衝擊、對危機作出應對，並自危機中恢復常態，以最終有助防止出現倒閉。金融管理專員負責對銀行進行審慎監管，以及認可香港的持牌銀行、有限制牌照銀行及接受存款公司（統稱「認可機構」）。金融管理專員亦負責某些金融市場基建的指定及監管。

然而，金融管理專員不能確保金融體系全無風險，香港的審慎監管制度亦非為了確保「零風險」而設。作為其中一個處置機制當局，金融管理專員力求確保一旦有認可機構不再可持續經營，即能有序地處理其倒閉。為此，香港已設立金融機構處置機制，金融管理專員於該機制之下作為包括認可機構在內的若干金融機構的處置機制當局。為建立運作暢順的香港處置機制，必須制定處置法例及政策標準、進行處置規劃以清除認可機構處置可行性的障礙，以及建立金管局處置無法經營的認可機構的運作能力。為有效執行上述工作，金管局需要採納與國際一致及協調的方法。

# 2018年回顧

# 監管工作概覽

金管局在2018年共進行187次非現場審查，涵蓋範圍廣泛，包括認可機構的CAMEL評級、企業管治、業務操作及風險管理，以及認可機構應對金融科技發展的業務策略。為繼續加強認可機構的風險管治水平，金管局與認可機構董事局或董事局轄下委員會共舉行27次會議，並跟進認可機構實施企業管治指引的進度。此外，金管局與認可機構及其外聘核數師共舉行28次三方聯席會議。

除了非現場審查工作外，金管局繼續進行定期現場審查，並以專題評估作為配合，以審視被評估為較高風險的範疇。金管局於年內共進行392次現場審查及專題評估，並繼續以信用風險管理作為審查與評估的主要重點。其他重點為科技風險及業務操作風險管理，以及打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集管控措施。金管局亦增加針對流動性與市場風險管理，以及巴塞爾資本充足架構的實施情況的現場審查及專題評估次數。專項審查小組亦對認可機構的證券、投資產品、保險及強制性公積金（強積金）相關業務進行現場審查。

# 信用風險的監管

# 信貸增長及資產質素

2018年信貸增長放緩，全年貸款總額增加4.4%，2017年的增幅則為16.1%（表2）。貿易融資於2018年減少7.6%。貸款增長放緩，主要是因為全球經濟及貿易環境越趨不明朗，以致信貸需求收縮。

內地相關貸款總額在2018年底增加1.4%至42,490億港元，低於2017年的增幅（表3）。

表3 內地相關貸款增長

認可機構的資產質素在2018年維持穩健。零售銀行的特定分類貸款比率由2017年底的0.56%下降至2018年底的0.50%，遠低於2000年以來的長期平均水平2.1%；同期，整體銀行業的特定分類貸款比率則由0.68%下降至0.55%。內地相關貸款方面，零售銀行的特定分類貸款比率由0.75%下降至2018年的0.63%，整體銀行業的相關比率亦由一年前的0.67%下降至0.54%。

年內金管局加強監管，確保認可機構繼續採取審慎的信用風險管理準則。尤其金管局更主動了解大型企業的背景及結構，從而加強企業信用風險的監察制度。此外，金管局亦進行以主要信用風險管理監控措施為重點的專題評估，例如大型企業貸款的批核準則及風險管理、貸款分類及撥備制度、信用風險管治架構、地產發展商貸款的風險管理、有抵押貸款及保單抵押貸款等。

# 物業按揭貸款

住宅物業價格在2018年7月到達歷史高位，但在下半年出現緩和跡象。金管局自2009年10月以來推出的8輪逆周期宏觀審慎監管措施，已增強香港銀行體系應對本港樓市可能逆轉的抵禦能力。新造住宅按揭貸款的平均按揭成數由2009年9月金管局推出首輪逆周期措施前的64%，降至2018年12月的46%。平均供款與入息比率亦由2010年8月首度推出有關比率上限時的41%，降至2018年12月的34%（圖1）。
